attributes.action: Don’t fine parents in Tier 4 areas for homeschooling their children in January
attributes.additional_details:
This will help reduce transmission in school bubbles as the children’s bubbles will be smaller. It also helps families that are trying to shield high risk family members. 
I don’t believe parents should be penalised for choosing to homeschool their children whilst in Tier 4, at least for the month of January.
attributes.background: In Tier 4 parents should be offered the flexibility for their children to attend school (where they are open) OR home school their children during this current peak in the pandemic (January 2021). Parents should not be fined by their schools or local boroughs for choosing to do so.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced that primary schools, secondary schools and colleges across England must move to remote provision from 5 January 2021, except for vulnerable children and the children of key workers.

You can read the Prime Minister's announcement of new Covid-19 restrictions, including school closures, here: https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/prime-ministers-address-to-the-nation-4-january-2021

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign: 

Enable online learning for children who live with those who are vulnerable: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556586

Scrap fines for families with vulnerable members that keep children from school: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549629
